bboxes.raw_text:
CAMBRIDGE. Ohio The
mother of an infant daughter,
fathered by blind singer Ray
Charles, says she has lost 40
pounds in recent months and is
under consta medical care.


Sandra Belts. former coed.
says her support money has been
halted and she has been worried
by the press and nosy persons.


She had won $4O0 a month
last January after a paternity
trial. The money was not paid
after she moved away from Los
Angeles because she failed to
notify the court. Her lawyer is
appealing the ruling.

TUCSON, ARIZONA : Mrs.
Sarah Fols ON has charged Super
intendent of Public Instruction W.
w. Dick is using his office to build
a personal political machine.


Mrs. Folsom. the Republican
candidate, also said that Dick is
afraid to discuss the issues be-
cause he is apparently incapable
of doing so without calling people
names. He resorts to political
name calling when Arizonans in
terested in education make sug-
gestions that don't suit his pat
tern of thinking


She asked the support of mem
bers of both political parties in
taking Arizona education of of
politics.

Mrs. Folsom Says
Skipper Is Boss

NETWORK = Gloria Richard
son, Al. we'll known civil rights
leader in Maryland, announced
her marriage recently to a 26
year old free lance photographer,
Frank cambridge.


Dandridge's first wife, Lynda,
u. however. insists that she
is legally married to him be-
cause she received no divorce
notification.


The first Mrs. cambridge Is
senior at Columbia University.
She is the mother of four year
old son.


Mrs. Gloria Richards on Dan
bridge said she will halt her
civil rights work andmove to New
York with her new spouse. She
has two children by former
marriage.

BOSTON = Edward w. Brooke,
the attorney general of Massa-
chusetts, has announced for a
second term, an an independent
because he finds that his prin-
ciples and those of the Republican
nominee, Sen. Barry G oldwater,
are incompatible. This action
caused him the loss of certain
financial aid.


Gregg Beams, chairman of
fund raising activities, has In
dicated that budget of $780, 900
is needed to conduct Mr.. Brooke's
campaign. He stated 1--WE need
dollars from every possible
source to support a winning cam
paign for winning candidate.
Contributions can be sent to the
Brooke Election Comm ttee at
IS Court Square, Boston, Mas
sachusetts.

Edward H. Pate has joined
Daniel ]. Edelman and As
sociates, Inc, international pub
lie relations agency, to head a
new Negro community relations
department which will provide
marketing, employee and COM
munity relations counsel.


Pate formerly was president Of
the Twin City Advertising, Kan
sas City, Mo-. specializing in
advertising and public relations
directed to the Negro community.


He was also president and
general manager of KPRS, Kan
sas City, one of three Negro
owned radio stations in the coun-
try at that time. The station
became a top-rated Kansas City
outlet while Pate served as its
chief executive officer.


Earlier IN MS career, rare was
a housing manager with the
Chicago Housing Authority and
administrator of Wheatley-Pro-
vident Hospital in Kansas City.


Pate is a graduate of the Uni
versity of Chicago and holds a
masters degree in business ad-
miniStration from the University.

Mrs. Carl Sims hosted sur
prise birthday for her husband,
Carl, at their home, 1921 w.
Madison on Sept. lo. More than
40 guests enjoyed the buffet din
ner.


Mrs. Leora Redmond, l4l2 S.
9th Ave, has returned from va
cation in Oklahoma, Louisiana
and Arkansas.


Mrs: Lilly Bats of San Fran
cisco spent weekend at the
home of Mrs. Mary bats, 1925
W. Grant.


Mrs. Myrtle Jackson, 1917 w.
Pimas enjoyed her visit to San
Diego and California.


Mrs. Cellar Hardy has re-
turned from visiting her daugh-
ter Mrs. Calvin Harris in St.
Louis, Mo.


Mrs. Ida Austin spent a won
derful time in Pinetop and Pres
colt, Ariz., before going to Las
Vegas.


Sgt. Willie Morris, son of Mrs.
Odessa Morris, l425 S. 18th Ave.,
is now stationed in the city. He
is on duty at the local recruiting
office, located on 9TH Ave. and
W. Washington. His wife and
four children accompanied him
from Fl. Belvoir, Va.


Jim Lewis is Ill at 1902 S.
18th Ave.


Rev. A. Nuns on, of Houston, a
boyhood friend of Rev. ]. D.
Daniels when he came to at Ma
cedonia Baptist Church Sunday.

A fanatic is anybody who is
highly enthusiastic about some
thing in which you aren't even
remotely interested.
